edu.rit.pj2

Class TupleSpace.Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.TupleSpace.Transaction
  • Enclosing class:
    TupleSpace

    public class TupleSpace.Transaction
extends Object
    Class TupleSpace.Transaction provides a transaction for finding and removing Tuples from TupleSpace. To perform a transaction:

    1. Create a transaction by calling the getTransaction() method on the TupleSpace object. At this point the tuple space object becomes locked.

    2. Call the transaction's iterator() method to get an iterator for scanning the references to tuples in tuple space.

    3. Use the iterator's methods to scan the tuples.

    4. To remove a certain tuple from tuple space, call the transaction's remove() method. This tentatively removes the tuple. (Don't call the iterator's remove() method; that method is not supported.)

    5. To put a removed tuple back into tuple space, call the transaction's restore() method. This tentatively restores the tuple.

    6. Steps 2, 3, 4, and 5 may be repeated as many times as necessary.

    7. To permanently accept all tentative changes made during the transaction, call the transaction's commit() method. At this point the transaction is finished and the tuple space object becomes unlocked.

    8. To undo all tentative changes and put tuple space back the way it was before the transaction was created, call the transaction's abort() method. At this point the transaction is finished and the tuple space object becomes unlocked.

    9. Call the transaction's getTuples() method, which returns a list of the tuples that were permanently removed by the transaction (if any).

    Class TupleSpace.Transaction is not multiple thread safe. It is assumed that the same thread will create a transaction and call the transaction's methods until the transaction is committed or aborted.

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        public Iterator<TupleSpace.TupleRef> iterator()
        Get an iterator for scanning the references to tuples in tuple space.

        Note: The returned iterator's remove() method is not supported.

        Returns:
        Iterator.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this transaction is not in progress.

      • remove

        public void remove(TupleSpace.TupleRef ref)
        Tentatively remove the given tuple reference from tuple space.
        Parameters:
        ref - Tuple reference.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this transaction is not in progress.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if ref is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if ref does not exist in tuple space.

      • restore

        public void restore(TupleSpace.TupleRef ref)
        Tentatively restore the given tuple reference to tuple space.
        Parameters:
        ref - Tuple reference.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this transaction is not in progress.
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if ref is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if ref does not exist in tuple space.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commit this transaction. All tentative changes to tuple space become permanent. Afterwards, this transaction is no longer in progress.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this transaction is not in progress.

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Abort this transaction. All tentative changes to tuple space are undone. Afterwards, this transaction is no longer in progress.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this transaction is not in progress.

      • getTuples

        public AList<Tuple> getTuples()
        Get the tuples that were removed from tuple space during this transaction. The tuples appear in the list in the order in which the tuples were removed from tuple space. If no tuples were removed, or if this transaction was aborted, an empty list is returned.
        Returns:
        List of removed tuples.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if this transaction is in progress.
